Data: 9.50 am Harare looks brutally cold this morning. The players are training with multiple layers on them, not including caps and gloves. Reports suggest the temperature is 11C and there's a bustling wind making things even harder. Even Alastair Campbell, a local, had to glove-up to do the toss.

Stanlake to Zhuwao, OUT caught behind first ball! Comes out braving the cold, goes back for an early coffee. #SmallMercies. Australia, meanwhile, are elated. Stanlake pitches it up outside off, has Zhuwao chasing after it. Normally, that would have screamed through the cover point boundary. But in this case - because of the lack of footwork
Stanlake to Masakadza, no run back of a length and outside off, leaves it. Hint of awayswing in the air for Stanlake
Stanlake to Masakadza, no run struck on the body as Masakadza looks to flick a shortish delivery angled into him
Stanlake to Masakadza, no run draws him into a lazy old drive and that away swing - that very late away swing - takes it past the outside edge. Stanlake's looking mean today. #WhatElseIsNew?
Stanlake to Masakadza, no run looks for the blockhole now and Masakadza brings down a straight bat to save himself
Stanlake to Masakadza, no run good length ball on middle, defends stoutly
Jhye Richardson to Mire, 1 run knocks it down gently straight of midwicket for a single. That's more like it. Mire playing close to the body, covering the line of a ball angled into middle

Jhye Richardson to Masakadza, no run pokes outside the off stump as Richardson hits a fuller length. Masakadza is stuck in the crease but his hands lunge out to meet the ball. Soft hands though, which is good

Jhye Richardson to Masakadza, 1 run dropped by the debutant! Jack Wildermuth tries to get under the skier at third man as Masakadza slogs wildly. The back of a length ball leaps off the top edge and starts to dip as it nears the fielder. Wildermuth has committed to take it reverse cup and even ends up diving forward in a desperate attempt t
Jhye Richardson to Mire, no run fuller delivery on middle, he turns it into the leg side
Jhye Richardson to Mire, 1 run hangs back and flicks a shortish delivery through midwicket
Jhye Richardson to Masakadza, 1 run angles a short of a good length delivery in at off stump, Masakadza plays late, chopping it to point for a quick single
Stanlake to Masakadza, FOUR runs goes short and Masakadza hoicks it through midwicket. Powerful strike. Standing tall, telling the bowler who's boss

Stanlake to Masakadza, 1 run another one that he digs into the pitch, this one coming up towards Masakadza's chest. The batsman pulls, gets struck on the glove, and as the ball wanders to square leg, he slinks through for a single

Stanlake to Mire, no run rippper! It beats Mire's outside edge and goes hunting for the off stump. Prey escapes predator by the smallest margin as the ball bounces just over it. Sensational stuff from Stanlake. Hitting the deck on middle and getting late away movement
Stanlake to Mire, no run full on middle, Mire blocks to cover

Stanlake to Mire, FOUR runs bang! Straight over the top! Mire's got quality. And he shows it by picking Stanlake's fuller length, striding confidently forward and smacking him over mid-on. An outstanding shot!
Stanlake to Mire, 1 run shortish and outside off, he dabs it to third man. Sensible batting. Controlled batting.
Jhye Richardson to Mire, 1 run extra bounce as Richardson bends his back and goes short. Mire goes for the pull on instinct and mistimes it to deep midwicket

Jhye Richardson to Masakadza, SIX runs scoops a fast bowler capable of hitting 140 kph all the way to the long leg boundary! Superb stuff from Masakadza, always has his eyes on the ball, and connects splendidly

Jhye Richardson to Masakadza, OUT chops on! A short and wide delivery that deserves to be cut through cover point ends up pinging off the inside edge onto the stumps. Seems like Masakadza is fooled by a throttling down in pace. A wicket each in the Powerplay for Australia's quicks. That's job well done
Jhye Richardson to Musakanda, 5 wide too short, and it even leaps over the wicketkeeper Carey to run away for four
Jhye Richardson to Musakanda, no run zips through past the top edge as Musakanda goes for a cut shot
Jhye Richardson to Musakanda, no run stays back and slices a shortish delivery to point
Jhye Richardson to Musakanda, no run sees width, goes after it, comes away swishing at thin air
Stoinis to Mire, 1 run shortish and outside off, glides it down to third man
Stoinis to Musakanda, 1 run taps the back of a length delivery into the covers for a quick single
Stoinis to Mire, no run targets the top of off but Mire gets in between the ball and the bulls-eye
Stoinis to Mire, 1 run a hint of width and that's enough for Mire to exploit
Stoinis to Musakanda, 1 run a slower ball, but he hits the deck with it. Musakanda reads it all perfectly, pulls his bottom hand off, nudges it to the left of the pitch and pinches a single
Stoinis to Mire, FOUR runs opens the face and finds a boundary. Very smart by Mire. He's in form. He's picking the ball well. And it is the change-bowler, so he definitely has to go after him
Stanlake to Musakanda, no run stays put in front of a shortish delivery and absorbs all of its threats with soft hands
Stanlake to Musakanda, FOUR runs short and wide and Musakanda latches onto it with a vengeance. Cut with all of his power to the point boundary
Stanlake to Musakanda, no run keeps going short and wide - but this time he makes sure it travels higher. Musakanda looks for the upper cut, but can't catch up with it
Stanlake to Musakanda, SIX runs that's insane! He presses forward, not caring that Stanlake releases that little white thing at near 150 kph - and quite effortlessly lifts it over mid-on

Stanlake to Musakanda, OUT appeal for a catch! It's Wildermuth down at thie third man boundary, running forward and diving low to pick up a fine catch. The umpires check for a no-ball and that's all they check for before sending Musakanda on his way. The dismissal is rather similar to the catch that Wildermuth dropped earlier in the game. A
Stanlake to Mire, no run they're going up again, but umpire Tiffin is unmoved. End of a top over from Stanlake, as he beats the bat of the set batsman with an outswinger at outrageous pace
Agar to Moor, no run tosses it up on off stump, drives to cover
Agar to Moor, 1 run nudges it through midwicket
Agar to Mire, no run goes back to a flatter delivery on off stump and pats it to extra cover
Agar to Mire, 1 run opens the face to find a single through to the sweeper
Agar to Moor, 2 runs looms over the flighted delivery in leg stump and deflects it to the left of short fine leg
Agar to Moor, 1 run hangs back to a shortish delivery and turns it through the vacant midwicket region
Tye to Moor, no run full on middle, pushes it back at the bowler
Tye to Moor, 1 run stands tall against a back of a length delivery outside off and punches it through to deep point

Tye to Mire, no run slower ball that deceives Mire. He's set up to launch it over the leg side, thinking it's length and it's in the slot. But the lack of pace makes him think twice and in the end leave it outside off
Tye to Mire, 1 run another slowy - perhaps the knuckle ball too, considering it moves in the air and squares Mire up. Outside edge down to point
Tye to Moor, 1 run takes the pace off again, but Moor is looking for it, adjusts his bat swing appropriately and flicks a straight one to long leg
Tye to Mire, 1 run spots the variation, hanging back until it finally arrives in his half of the pitch. Little late cut thereafter sends it down to third man
Agar to Mire, 1 run clears the front leg and laces an overpitched delivery right at his partner at the other end. Single as the ball deflects over to long-on
Agar to Moor, no run tosses it up on middle and leg, Moor defends

Agar to Moor, 2 runs leading edge... swirling away past the shoulder of Tye, running back from cover.... lands safely. Superb bowling from Agar, even if it doesn't result in a wicket. Lobbing the ball up over the batsman's eyeline and getting it to dip and turn so that a hit straight down the ground becomes a panic-stricken wait for Moor to
Agar to Moor, 1 run
Agar to Mire, 1 run clears the front leg again as Agar targets leg stump and hits the length ball down to long-on
Agar to Moor, no run flatter and fuller on off stump, Moor drills it back to the left-arm spinner
Wildermuth to Mire, 1 run good length ball outside off stump, the batsman pushes it through cover point
Wildermuth to Moor, 3 runs gets up off his toes so that he can hit the short ball on top of its bounce and send it scampering away to the left of both point and the sweeper cover. Good technique
Wildermuth to Mire, 1 run pitches it up, angling the ball into the right-hander. Mire skews it off the inside edge to deep square leg
Wildermuth to Moor, no run bouncer, which keeps coming in at the batsmen. Moor drops his wrists and avoids contact
Wildermuth to Moor, 1 run defends a shortish delivery to the right of point
Wildermuth to Mire, 1 run pulls a rising delivery from outside off to long-on. Not enough room, and perhaps more pertinently, too much bounce for him to properly time the ball
Stoinis to Mire, 1 run opens the face to guide a good length ball to third man
Stoinis to Moor, no run flirts with a back of a length delivery outside off and is comfortably beaten. Tiny bit more bounce than Moor is ready for
Stoinis to Moor, no run he's forced back into his crease by a short ball, coming up towards his chest. Moor does well in the end, to use soft hands and blunt it by his feet
Stoinis to Moor, no run gets forward to drill a fuller delivery to mid-off
Stoinis to Moor, 1 wide goes for a bouncer outside off, but it may just have wandered too high for its own good

Stoinis to Moor, 1 run direct hit would have knocked Mire out! Maxwell is the man at point, cutting the angle very well as he runs to his left to grab the ball and take a shy at the strikers' end. Decent shot from Moor, but not the best judgment of a run
Stoinis to Mire, 1 run slogs a back of a length delivery to long-on
Stanlake to Mire, no run sharp pace again as he goes full and outside off. Mire camps on leg stump, not really keen on getting in line with the delivery and so ends up comfortably beaten
Stanlake to Mire, no run short ball now, only a shade outside off stump. The lack of room, and that it comes near his shoulder, makes Mire decide not to dabble with it
Stanlake to Mire, no run swishes outside off - this one giving him a little more width to free the arms - but Stanlake's got too much heat on the ball
Stanlake to Mire, 1 run rocks back to slap the short delivery outside off to point
Stanlake to Moor, no run yorker on off stump, Moor digs it out
Stanlake to Moor, no run back of a length and outside off, slaps it to point
Tye to Mire, 2 runs works his wrists over a shortish delivery on middle and finds a couple between long-on and midwicket
Tye to Mire, 1 wide backs away, prompting Tye to follow the batsman and go as short as he can. But with this pitch already offering plenty of bounce, the ball soars over Mire's head as he leaves

Tye to Mire, 2 runs launches it in the air, and it lands safely, just beyond the reach of a diving Maxwell! Superb work, in travelling so fast to catch up with the outside edge, and even while doing so, tracking the ball over his shoulder. Big dive to make something happen, but it falls just in front of his outstetched hand
Tye to Mire, no run
Tye to Mire, 2 runs good length ball on middle, which is turned through midwicket. Mire plays with soft hands looking for two and he gets it
Tye to Mire, 2 runs slogs a length ball outside off to deep square leg

Tye to Mire, no run knuckle ball utterly deceives Mire, and for a second time, it only just misses his stumps. Stanlake had a chance at knocking out his off stump earlier in the day. Now Tye comes within inches of messing the middle one up. A slog with no luck or skill attached to it
Stoinis to Moor, SIX runs clatters a short ball outside off away over deep midwicket. Good work in getting on top of the bounce to connect as cleanly as he did
Stoinis to Moor, FOUR runs another superb shot, this one along the ground, it's USP the placement. It skips past point on his left, and then bisects the sweeper and deep third man
Stoinis to Moor, FOUR runs and there's the little bit of luck a batsman needs. Stoinis goes to top pace as he tries to bounce Moor. He goes for the pull and gets a top edge over the keeper
Stoinis to Moor, 1 run slower ball on middle, Moor taps it to point. That's the fifty partnership
Stoinis to Mire, FOUR runs scoops a length ball on middle stump over the short fine leg fielder. That's 19 off the over already
Stoinis to Mire, no run knuckle ball, bobbles out to become a yorker too. Mire keeps it out
Agar to Moor, 1 run top-edges the slog and three men are haring up after it, from deep midwicket, long-on and even the bowler looking to make something of it. Lands right between them
Agar to Mire, no run slings it through from a low arm, and at a much higher pace, as Mire swings and misses
Agar to Mire, 1 run another very quick delivery on middle, Mire nudges it to cover for a single
Agar to Moor, 1 leg bye tries a slog sweep, but mistimes it so badly the wicketkeeper gets to it

Agar to Mire, FOUR runs reverse sweep now, and it s a superb shot, simply because Agar is bowling quick and at off stump, with third man and point up. Mire spots the flaw in Australia's plans and exploits it superbly

Agar to Mire, SIX runs makes room and lashes a short ball over deep midwicket, into the grass banks. Brutal hit from Mire and Zimbabwe have finally got their groove on. Thirty-two runs off the last two overs.
Jhye Richardson to Moor, no run spots Moor making room and so slows his pace down and plants the ball wide outside off. Clever bowling earns a dot
Jhye Richardson to Moor, 1 wide he's worried that Moor would be making room again and goes too wide outside off. Penalised
Jhye Richardson to Moor, no run back of a length and outside off, Moor looks for a late cut but is beaten

Jhye Richardson to Moor, OUT carves it over the top - and he really has timed the pants off it - the only problem is it sails straight to deep point. Moor takes on the long boundary and comes up short. He had to hit out though, with only four-ish overs left
Jhye Richardson to Mire, no run back of a length and outside off, slashes and misses
Jhye Richardson to Mire, 1 run full and outside off, slices it to deep point
Jhye Richardson to Chigumbura, 1 run full on off stump, he nudges it towards mid-on
Tye to Chigumbura, 1 run shortish on off stump - no pace on it though - as Chigumbura knocks it down towards where short midwicket would have been
Tye to Mire, 1 run stands tall and pulls a slower short ball out to deep midwicket to bring up his second fifty in successive games
Tye to Chigumbura, no run cramps him for room with a top-pace delivery on off stump. Chigumbura mistimes a late cut to point
Tye to Chigumbura, OUT top edge, taken by square leg running in! It's a short ball, not really affording him the room to swing his arms. Also comes onto him too quickly, leading to a mis-hit.
Tye to Mire, FOUR runs full and outside off, Mire slogs away, but gets a leading edge over short third man. Knuckle ball deceives the batsman, but he still profits
Tye to Mire, SIX runs massive! This time he nails the back of a length delivery off the middle of the bat and it sails over the backward square leg boundary. Mire's on fire. (Had to be said)
Jhye Richardson to Waller, 1 run good length ball on off stump, blocks behind point
Jhye Richardson to Mire, no run wide yorker - perfectly executed. Even Mire can't make something out of it.

Jhye Richardson to Mire, 1 run runs outside off to try to try and scoop the ball - but the perils of premeditation is that he has missed out on a full toss, which he could have hammered over the off side
Jhye Richardson to Waller, SIX runs backs away and hammers a short ball over extra cover. What a shot! The timing on it! The sound of it leaving the bat!

Jhye Richardson to Waller, FOUR runs full toss outside off, smears it to the left of the sweeper cover. Two balls faced, two super shots for boundaries. Malcolm Waller is just what Zimbabwe needed right now
Jhye Richardson to Waller, 1 run adjusts to the back of the hand slower ball and lashes it away to the sweeper. Twenty-five runs off the last two overs
Tye to Waller, 1 run drills a near yorker on leg stump out to extra cover
Tye to Mire, 1 run looks for another yorker on middle, Mire gets it off the inside edge to short fine leg

Tye to Waller, OUT taken by deep square leg! Good work from Tye, and it's his go-to delivery too. Change of pace, which is perfect against a batsman wanting to slog everything. Waller goes for a pull, mistimes it and ends up being caught, and quite easily at that
Tye to Mire, no run full and outside off, slaps it to extra cover

Tye to Mire, 1 run, OUT he risks a second in an effort to retain strike, but Tiiripano is not quick enough, nor does he dive. Mire hits to long-off. It should have only been a single but Zimbabwe need the established batsman on strike. They'll get that, but Tiripano's gone

Tye to Mire, OUT full and straight. Mire goes across the line for a slog over wide long-on - he kinda has no choice but to play shots line that - and makes no contact. That means the ball has a clear path to uproot off stump. Fifty wickets in T20s in 2018 for Tye
Wildermuth to Mavuta, FOUR runs full toss outside off, Mavuta smashes it to the point boundary
Wildermuth to Mavuta, 1 run back of a length and outside off, blocks to point
Wildermuth to Masakadza, 2 runs shortish and on off stump, pulls through wide mid-on
Wildermuth to Masakadza, 1 run slower delivery, well wide outside off, Masakadza skews it to deep point
Wildermuth to Mavuta, 1 run full and outside off, slaps it to mid-off

Wildermuth to Masakadza, OUT walks across outside off, trying to smash the ball over the top, perhaps a lot straighter than mid-off. But that's where it goes and Marcus Stoinis, running back, takes it over his shoulder. Fine effort to give the debutant a first ODI wicket

11.35 am Solomon Mire was the only man who had any measure of the Australian attack. It's not that they were unplayable but the extra pace that Billy Stanlake is capable of definitely did rattle the top order. He created the pressure, which allowed the change bowlers just enough leeway to get into the game. Zimbabwe couldn't find the boundary for

11.40 am Right, we're already set to go. Aaron Finch is at the strikers' end. Alex Carey at the other. Zimbabwe have jogged out to the middle as well, but they have a substitute keeping wicket. Ryan Murray will take over the gloves from Peter Moor, who is not on the ground. Left-arm spinner Wellington Masakadza to take the new ball
Masakadza to Finch, 1 leg bye full and drifting into the pads, Finch tries to dab it fine, but he can't make contact with the bat.
Masakadza to Carey, 1 run stays around the wicket to the left-hander too, and Carey pulls the flatter delivery outside off to deep midwicket
Masakadza to Finch, 1 run backs away outside leg, but Masakadza follows him with a quicker delivery. Finch flicks through midwicket
Masakadza to Carey, no run keeps pushing it through in line with the stumps, Carey blocks

Masakadza to Carey, FOUR runs gets down low to scoop the ball right over the keeper's head. Premeditated shot, which is how Masakadza is able to adjust and bowl as quick as he can. Carey overbalances as he makes contact, but it's still good enough
Masakadza to Carey, 1 run nudges it through midwicket
Muzarabani to Carey, 1 run shortish and at the hip, Carey turns it behind square leg
Muzarabani to Finch, 1 run flicks another back of a length delivery from off stump away to deep square leg
Muzarabani to Carey, no run opens the face to steer a short delivery outside off to point

Muzarabani to Carey, 1 run unsettles the left-hander by targeting the body - Muzarabani is well over six-feet tall, so its no surprise that he's getting awkward bounce. Single off a flick behind square leg
Muzarabani to Finch, 1 wide tries to glance the ball, sliding down leg, to the boundary but he can't touch it
Muzarabani to Finch, 1 run tries to pull a short and wide delivery - perhaps off pace as well - and gets an inside edge to deep square leg
Muzarabani to Carey, 2 runs lifts a good length ball straight down the ground - but this has gone high. Mid-off and mid-on are racing after it, but the ball lands just in front of them both
Masakadza to Carey, no run shortish on off stump, defends
Masakadza to Carey, 1 run shapes to pull, but he doesn't read the pace of the ball off the pitch properly and mistimes the shot so badly that it doesn't even go too far off the pitch
Masakadza to Head, 1 run turns a fuller delivery on leg stump through midwicket
Masakadza to Carey, no run run-out chance as the left-hander digs out a yorker and the non-striker thinks there's a single at cover. Carey sends Head back and a dive saves the Australian
Masakadza to Carey, 1 leg bye goes for the slog sweep and gets struck on the back leg. But Masakadza's delivery pitches outside leg so the lbw appeal won't stand
Tiripano to Carey, FOUR runs full delivery outside off, Carey smacks it through extra cover. Pace on the ball making a difference in favour of Austrlaia
Tiripano to Carey, 1 run short on middle, he pulls to deep square leg
Tiripano to Head, no run stands up tall behind a back of a length delivery on off stump and defends to point
Tiripano to Head, 1 wide drifts down the leg side and Head doesn't make contact with the flick
Tiripano to Head, no run rises with the bouncer on middle and off stump and blunts it by his feet
Tiripano to Head, no run opens the face and slices the shortish delivery to point
Tiripano to Head, 2 runs slower ball on leg stump, Head works it to deep square leg
Muzarabani to Carey, no run short and outside off, Carey glides it behind point, but the fielder does well, putting in a dive
Muzarabani to Carey, no run blocks a shortish delivery down the pitch and sets off looking for a single. Realises it's not there just in time

Muzarabani to Carey, OUT caught behind! Superb work from Muzarabani. He spent his couple of overs targeting Carey's body. Now he sends one angled across the left-hander. Carey flirts with it, looking for a single to third man, and only ends up nicking through. Pace, plenty of bounce and early success for the tall right-arm quick
Muzarabani to Maxwell, 1 wide strays down the pads, Maxwell misses out on the flick
Muzarabani to Maxwell, 1 run tucks a good length ball outside off through square leg

Muzarabani to Head, 1 run stays put in his crease to defend another rising delivery from Muzarabani. His lines to the left-handers has been very very good so far. Head gets an inside edge on this occasion and Maxwell scampers through for a single
Muzarabani to Maxwell, no run full and outside off, he drives to point
Tiripano to Head, no run full and outside of, Head lashes it to point
Tiripano to Head, no run drives in solid fashion to cover. Tiripano hitting good areas on and around off stump
Tiripano to Head, no run walks down the pitch - showing he's under pressure over the lack of runs. Tiripano bangs it in short, and it wanders past Head's shirt, and right over leg stump
Tiripano to Head, FOUR runs gets under the short ball to lift it over the keeper and away to the third man boundary. Upper cut, well executed
Tiripano to Head, 1 run walks out and across his stumps again to flick through to mid-on
Tiripano to Maxwell, 1 leg bye prepares a flick shot, but the ball not coming onto the bat puts him off. It eventually ends up deflecting off the pads to short fine leg
Mire to Maxwell, 1 run full on off stump, Maxwell pushes it to mid-off and pinches a single
Mire to Head, no run short and wide, but since it's slow as well it beats Head's cut shot
Mire to Head, 2 runs full and outside off, Head drives sweetly through the covers
Mire to Head, FOUR runs nicks it past the keeper! Taking the pace off is working big time on this pitch. It's offering extra bounce as well and both of those combine to mess with Head's cut shot
Mire to Head, 2 runs another slower ball, which Head deflects away to deep third man
Mire to Head, 1 run short and on leg stump, he pulls to long leg
Mavuta to Head, no run leading edge first up as he tosses it up on leg stump and Head is lunging for the ball, meeting it too early
Mavuta to Head, 2 wide pushes it through down leg. Head looks for a flick, no luck there. but he does get a wide and then rushes for a single as the keeper fumbles the take
Mavuta to Maxwell, no run flights it on off stump, Maxwell plays for turn, but the drift into the right-hander secures an inside edge
Mavuta to Maxwell, 2 runs drives through the covers for a couple. Australia almost solely concentrating on singles and twos to recover lost ground
Mavuta to Maxwell, 1 run short and wide, Maxwell cuts to deep point
Mavuta to Head, 2 runs googly from the debutant, which Head dabs away to deep third man
Mavuta to Head, no run misreads the googly this time. It's tossed up, drifting away from the left-hander, turning as well. Head is only gingerly playing at it and gets an edge that goes nowhere
Mire to Maxwell, 1 run shapes to pick a short ball off middle stump over square leg. But he's into the shot too early and ends up hitting it off a leading edge to point

Mire to Head, no run struck on the helmet Head is into a pull shot and goes through with it too soon. The ball strikes him on the side of his head. He doesn't seem to be in any sort of trouble though. Sends Maxwell, who is looking for a single, back and then later the physio too.
Mire to Head, 2 runs pulls a short ball away behind square leg
Mire to Head, 2 runs flicks a shortish delivery to long leg
Mire to Head, 1 run slower ball outside off, Head drives to mid-off for a single
Mire to Maxwell, 1 run dipping slower ball on middle, Maxwell presents the full face for a single to long-on
Mavuta to Maxwell, 1 run flicks a short one from middle and off stump to deep midwicket
Mavuta to Head, 2 runs short ball, which Head pulls past Masakadza's left. The throw from the deep hits the stumps direct at the striker's end and ricochets for an overthrow

Mavuta to Head, 2 runs shifts his weight back against the shortish delivery and flicks it behind square leg. Smart footwork from Head, who wants a second. He needs to hurry. The throw from Muzarabani is right next to the stumps... Replays have it very very tight... and Head may well have been in by a frame. Those zing bails might have helpe
Mavuta to Head, 1 run works a good length ball off the back foot towards square leg

Mavuta to Maxwell, SIX runs shovels it all the way over the extra cover boundary! Maxwell is reaching out - it would have been a wide had he missed it - but Maxwell still manages to hit it with monstrous power
Mavuta to Maxwell, 1 run pushes it through on off stump, Maxwell is waiting for the change in length as he calmly flicks through midwicket
Waller to Maxwell, no run skids through past the pads of Maxwell even as he tries to flick it away. Deflection off the pad puts the keeper off from collecting it
Waller to Maxwell, SIX runs smashes it over long-on! Simply done by Maxwell as he meets a half volley with the full face and ensures it has enough of his strength to take it all the way
Waller to Maxwell, 2 runs rank delivery - short and down leg - Maxwell pulls it away to the left of long leg. Muzarabani saves a boundary
Waller to Maxwell, 1 run quicker delivery outside off, Maxwell pushes it to long-off
Waller to Head, 1 run on the pads, Head nudges it to deep midwicket
Waller to Maxwell, no run flatter delivery on middle, Maxwell clears his front leg and punches to midwicket
Mavuta to Head, 1 run googly on middle, Head hangs back and turns it to square leg.
Mavuta to Maxwell, no run shapes to slog a legbreak over long-on but hitting against the turn - especially when the ball is way outside off - is rarely helpful. Maxwell is beaten
Mavuta to Maxwell, 1 run googly on off stump, Maxwell swings it around to short fine leg
Mavuta to Head, FOUR runs long hope which Head monsters away to the midwicket boundary.
Mavuta to Head, 1 run comes down the track and though the bowler tries to stump him by sneaking the ball down leg, Head is able to flick it away to deep square leg
Mavuta to Maxwell, 1 run quicker delivery on middle, Maxwell goes back to block and gets an outside edge through point
Masakadza to Maxwell, 1 run defends a full delivery on off stump towards point. Another straightforward single
Masakadza to Head, 1 run shimmies down the pitch and lifts the length ball on leg stump away to deep midwicket
Masakadza to Maxwell, FOUR runs backs away and smears a full delivery on leg stump over to the extra cover boundary. Brutal strike, one that showcases his bottom-hand strength
Masakadza to Maxwell, 2 runs shortish on middle, Maxwell taps it to the empty spaces at mid-on and midwicket to take a couple
Masakadza to Maxwell, no run good length on off stump, defends
Masakadza to Maxwell, 2 runs full on middle, Maxwell turns it to long-on
Waller to Head, 1 run shortish and outside off, Head slaps it past the left of point
Waller to Maxwell, SIX runs length ball, asking to be hit and Maxwell doesn't disappoint. Presses forward and launches it over midwicket.
Waller to Maxwell, 1 run short now, and Maxwell pulls it away to the left of deep midwicket
Waller to Head, no run gets the late cut going but he can't beat short third man
Waller to Head, 1 run gets down the track and yorks himself. Only an inside edge saves him from being bowled
Waller to Maxwell, 1 run short and outside off, Maxwell cuts to the sweeper
Mavuta to Maxwell, 1 wide loops the googly up so very wide outside off. Maxwell thinks about it, but settles for the wide
Mavuta to Maxwell, 1 run pulls a short ball away to deep midwicket
Mavuta to Head, 2 runs shortish and outside off, Head cuts it behind point
Mavuta to Head, 1 run shapes to slog a tossed up delivery on leg stump, but it spins the wrong way, so he has to chop the ball into the off side for a single.
Mavuta to Maxwell, no run cuts the flatter delivery to point
Mavuta to Maxwell, no run googly on off stump, Maxwell defends, reading the variation just about well enough
Mavuta to Maxwell, no run makes room outside leg to open up the covers, but because he goes hard at the ball, he mistimes it back at the bowler

Masakadza to Head, 1 run dropped but it is a seriously difficult chance because Head rushes down the pitch and gets an outside edge while trying to loft over the covers. Could have had him stumped too.
Masakadza to Maxwell, no run

Masakadza to Maxwell, SIX runs length ball - offering Maxwell room to free the arms too - and he takes full toll of it. Winds up and launches the bad ball over long-on to bring up his half-century. Points at both of his eyes in celebration, while the umpires bring out a new ball.
Masakadza to Maxwell, no run good length on middle stump, defends
Masakadza to Maxwell, SIX runs short and wide, Maxwell pummels it straight down the ground. Another powerful hit for six
Masakadza to Maxwell, no run spears a quick delivery in at leg stump, Maxwell inside edges it
Muzarabani to Head, 1 run inside edges a short ball and it wanders out to long leg. Muzarabani's bounce is still so very unsettling
Muzarabani to Maddinson, 1 run gets his shuffle on to work a back of a length delivery on off stump away to deep midwicket
Muzarabani to Head, 1 run slower ball on leg stump, Head taps it towards square leg
Muzarabani to Maddinson, no run good length on middle, Maddinson defends
Muzarabani to Maddinson, 1 run rises with the short ball and steers it quite nicely to deep third man

Tiripano to Maddinson, 1 leg bye goes for a pull seeing the length short, but it's also a slower ball and that deceives Maddinson as he is hit on the body. Still, Australia get a leg bye with Head calling him through for a single
Tiripano to Head, 1 run full and outside off, drills it to mid-off
Tiripano to Head, 1 run offcutter, which Head nudges through square leg
Tiripano to Stoinis, 2 runs full on off stump, he tucks it to the right of long-on, with soft hands, to ensure he can get a couple of runs before the deep fielders get a look in
Tiripano to Stoinis, 1 run pulls a slower short ball out to deep midwicket
Muzarabani to Stoinis, 1 run works a good length ball on leg stump out to deep square leg

Muzarabani to Head, OUT caught at long-on! Australia are goofing off with a win in sight! The set batsman - Head, who has been ever so careful to avoid any risk in his game today - goes for a big shot with the run-rate just barely over 6. And he finds Masakadza waiting to pounce on his mistake
Muzarabani to Stoinis, 2 runs good length ball outside off gets Stoinis forward with a defensive push. It results in an outside edge that wanders away to deep third man

Muzarabani to Stoinis, 1 run goes straight up! Long-on is right on the edge of the boundary. Masakdaza, alancing himself as well as he could, takes the catch reverse cup. But he is starting to overbalance, so he flicks the ball back into the field of play. So close for Zimbabwe... So close...
Muzarabani to Agar, 2 runs full and outside off, Agar drives to cover. Stoinis at the other end is looking for a single, which is why Waller takes a shy at the stumps and gives away two overthrows
Muzarabani to Agar, 1 run back of a length and outside off, steers it to deep point
Tiripano to Agar, 1 wide starts with a short ball that goes way wide outside leg
Tiripano to Agar, 1 wide slower ball outside off, Agar flashes and misses as it spins away from him. Harsh call from the umpire to label that a wide though. Doubt it was.
Tiripano to Agar, no run good length and it's the offcutter again. Agar pokes and misses
Tiripano to Agar, 1 run low full toss which Agar inside edges onto pad. Stoinis, the better batsman of the two, races away to steal the strike.
Tiripano to Stoinis, 1 run slower short ball, which Stoinis pulls for a single to deep square leg
Tiripano to Agar, 1 run smacks it to mid-off and just sets off. Masakadza fumbles as well, allowing Australia's desperation move to succeed, despite his recovery and subsequent direct hit
Tiripano to Stoinis, FOUR runs low full toss, which Stoinis smashes over square leg and it's Australia's game

But Glenn Maxwell (56 off 38) and Travis Head (48 off 42) saw past their threat and will rightly be credited with this victory. Their 100-plus partnership after two early wickets stabilised the innings. But that collapse in the end would have sent a few nerves jangling. Three wickets in the last five overs, with a straightforward win in sight, wi

1.30 pm Zimbabwe - minus several of their best players and their premier fast bowler injured - have forced Australia to take a modest chase of 152 all the way to the penultimate ball of the match. The W won't be against their name, but Hamilton Masakadza's men have fought so very hard today; it was their last chance in the tri-series for a win an
That's all we have for you today. Tune in on Sunday when we return for the final between Australia and Pakistan.
Australia won by 5 wickets (with 1 ball remaining)
Player of the match is Andrew Tye, AUS
